entries.titlep: Sheng ming de ying xiang: Taiwan ji lu pian de qi tang ke
entries.publication: Taibei: Guo li zhong yang da xue dian ying wen hua yan jiu shi, [2007].
entries.note: Seven recent Taiwan documentary films are presented with introductions to each film, history of awards, director’s words, in-depth film reviews, related academic essays, and futher reading recommendations.Includes Filmography of Taiwan documentary film history 1966-2006.

entries.authorp: Chen Meng, Lin Xudong zhu bian.
entries.titlec: 首届北京国际纪录片学术会议文献汇编
entries.titlep: Shou ji Beijing guo ji ji lu pian xu shu hui yi wen jian hui bian
entries.publication: Beijing: Zhong yang dian shi tai, xin wen ping lun bu nei bu fa xing, 1997.
entries.note: Internally distributed conference proceedings of the First Beijing International Documentary Film Conference in 1997. Includes papers presented by the scholars and documentary film makers from the U.S., France, Germany, Australia, and Taiwan.

entries.title: A retrospective collection of documentary films from Taiwan
entries.titlec: 台灣當代影像: 從紀錄到實驗 1930-2003
entries.titlep: Taiwan dang dai ying xiang: cong ji shi dao shi yan 1930-2003
entries.publication: Taibei: Tong xi wen hua chu ban gong zuo shi, 2006.
entries.note: This book is published with a set of more than thirty documentary films on fifteen DVDs. It includes a collection of twenty essays exploring the development of Taiwan documentary films from 1930-2003 and the relationship between societal changes and documentary films. Includes theoretical discussions, analyses, and reviews of Taiwan documentary films.Includes Bibliography.

entries.titlec: 台灣地區紀錄片篇目資料庫紀錄片歷史及紀錄資深影人口述歷史計畫第一年成果報告
entries.titlep: Taiwan di qu ji lu pian pian mu zi liao ku ji lu pian li shi ji ji lu zi shen ying ren kou shu li shi ji hua di yi nian cheng guo bao gao
entries.publication: Taibei: Xing zheng yuan wen hua jian she wei yuan hui, 1998.
entries.note: Author Jim Cheng noticed this title in the bibliography of a book but could not locate the actual text at the three major libraries housing film materials in Taipei (NCL, NTU, and CTFA).

entries.titlec: 台灣地區紀錄片篇目資料庫紀錄片歷史及紀錄資深影人口述歷史計畫第二年成果報告
entries.titlep: Taiwan di qu ji lu pian pian mu zi liao ku ji lu pian li shi ji ji lu zi shen ying ren kou shu li shi ji hua di er nian cheng guo bao gao
entries.publication: Taibei: Xing zheng yuan wen hua jian she wei yuan hui, 1999.
entries.note: Author Jim Cheng noticed this title in the bibliography of a book but could not locate the actual text at the three major libraries housing film materials in Taipei (NCL, NTU, and CTFA).

entries.authorc: 台灣電影珍貴影像史料目錄 (第一輯 35年 – 58年) / 台灣電影文化公司.
entries.authorp: Taiwan dian ying zhen gui ying xiang shi liao mu lu (Di yi ji 35 nian -58 nian) / Taiwan dian ying wen hua gong si.
entries.titlep: Taibei: Taiwan dian ying wen hua gong si, [1969].
entries.note: A filmography, organized by film production date, of news and documentary films distributed by Taiwan dian ying wen hua gong si (Taiwan Film Culture Company) from 1945-1969.

entries.authorc: 台灣紀錄片美學系列 (二)  = Taiwan documentary aesthetic series II / 林竇元等策畫.
entries.authorp: Taiwan ji lu pian mei xue xi lie (er) = Taiwan documentary aesthetic series II / Lin Baoyuan deng ce hua.
entries.titlep: Taizhong: Guo li Taiwan mei shu guan, 2010.
entries.note: This work is the 2nd in a series; it contains the same title and uses the same publishing house. Again, five Taiwan documentary film studies scholars were invited to act as curators for the project, and each scholar presents his/her perspective on the development and changes of Taiwan documentary film aesthetics in this work.Vol. 1: “Colonization and decolonization: social, historical, and aesthetic consciousness in Taiwan's documentary films in the post-martial law era” by Catherine Lim Yuan.Vol. 2: “What to say and how to say it?: documentaries ; narrative strategies and formal considerations” by Lee Yungchuan.Vol. 3: “Technology and ethics” by Qiu Guifen.Vol. 4: “The documentation of subject and the subject of documentation: the political nature of the "Amateur aesthetics" of documentary films” by Kuo Li-hsin.Vol. 5: “Recording youth ; bitterness, struggle and growth” by Wei Di.Includes both Chinese and English versions of the curator’s essays, a film list, and records of the panel discussions.

entries.titlep: Taiwan xin wen
entries.publication: Taibei: Xing zheng yuan wen hua jian she wei yuan hui, 2000.
entries.note: The most comprehensive filmography of Taiwan news and documentary films produced from 1907-1999. Divided into two parts: 1) Part One: Colonial Period, organized by film production date; 2) Part 2: After Taiwan Retrocession, organized according to the seventeen institutions that housed the films. Each entry in the filmography consists of detailed information including: a synopsis, current film location, copyright holder, source, record code, name of person recording the film information, and date. Since the filmography has no index and is organized by production date or by institution name, it is difficult to search for film titles, directors, producers, or film content.

entries.titlec: 文化紀錄片研討匯集 (壹)
entries.titlep: Wen hua ji lu pian yan tao hui ji (yi)
entries.publication: Taibei: Xing zheng yuan wen hua jian she wei yuan hui, 1997.
entries.note: The official publication of The First Cultural Heritage Documentary Festival and Symposium in 1996. Includes a map, an introduction of the lecturers, a program, film synopses, records of the panel discussions and papers presented during the symposium, an analysis of the results of a student survey, an evalutation, and a conclusion.

entries.titlec: 文化紀錄片研討匯集 (貳)
entries.titlep: Wen hua ji lu pian yan tao hui ji (er)
entries.publication: Taibei: Xing zheng yuan wen hua jian she wei yuan hui, 1998.
entries.note: The official publication of The Second Cultural Heritage Documentary Festival and Symposium in 1997. Includes a map, an introduction of the lecturers, a program, film synopses, records of the panel discussions and papers presented during the symposium, an analysis of the results of a student survey, an evalutation, and a conclusion.

entries.titlec: 文化紀錄片研討匯集 (叁)
entries.titlep: Wen hua ji lu pian yan tao hui ji (san)
entries.publication: Taibei: Xing zheng yuan wen hua jian she wei yuan hui, 1999.
entries.note: The official publication of The Third Cultural Heritage Documentary Festival and Symposium in 1998. Includes a map, an introduction of the lecturers, a program, film synopses, records of the panel discussions and papers presented during the symposium, an analysis of the results of a student survey, an evalutation, and a conclusion.Compared with the previous two festivals and symposiums, the main difference is that mainland China documentary films and scholars participated in this festival and symposium.

entries.authorc: 策劃蔡崇隆; 著作陳昭如, 周富美.
entries.authorp: Ce hua Cai Chonglong; Zhu zuo Chen Zhaoru, Zhou Fumei.
entries.titlep: You zheng – yu du bing cun
entries.publication: Taibei: Tong xi wen hua chu ban gong zuo shi, 2008.
entries.note: A special publication about the documentary film dealing with the Taizhong chemical (PCBs) pollution case in 1979.Appendix includes the similar pollution cases in Japan and Vietnam.

entries.authorc: 計劃主持人: 古碧玲, 李泳泉; 專案執行人: 邱垂達, 郭書鳳.
entries.authorp: Ji hua zhu chi ren: Gu Biling, Li Yongquan; Zhuan an zhi xing ren: Qiu Chuida, Guo Shufeng.
entries.titlec: “再見, 台灣激情年代” 專案結案報告書
entries.titlep: “Zai jian, Taiwan ji qing nian dai” zhuan an jie an bao gao shu
entries.publication: Taibei: Xing zheng yuan wen hua jian she wei yuan hui, 2003.
entries.note: A report of the government-sponsored study of Taiwan Social Movement Documentary Films during the 1980s and 1990s. Topics include the 5/20 Incident, Environmental Protection, Women’s rights, Student movements, and other social, political, and cultural issues. Includes interviews of 13 documentary film directors, records of the Social Movement Documentary Film Preservation project, and a Filmography of preserved Social Movement documentary films.

entries.title: Representing reality: International Conference on documentary aesthetics.
entries.titlec: 真實與再現: 紀錄片美學國際學術研討會論文集
entries.titlep: Zhen shi yu zai xian: Ji lu pian mei xue guo ji xue shu yan tao jui lun wen ji
entries.publication: Taibei: Xing zheng yuan wen hua jian she wei yuan hui, 2002.
entries.note: Conference proceedings and program of The 2002 Taiwan International Documentary Festival, which consisted of an exhibition of films and a conference. This document includes the conference program and papers presented by two foreign scholars and nine Taiwan scholars.The program is in both Chinese and English; the papers are in their original languages, but every Chinese paper has an English abstract.

entries.authorc: 臺灣民族誌影像學會主辦 ; 中央研究院民族學研究所博物館等協辦.
entries.authorp: Taiwan min zu zhi ying xiang xue hui zhu ban; Zhong yang yan jiu yuan min zu xue yan jiu suo deng xie ban.
entries.title: Taiwan international ethnographic film festival ; Family Variations
entries.titlec: 2005台灣國際民族誌影展 : 家的變奏
entries.titlep: 2005 Taiwan guo ji min zu zhi ying zhan: jia de bian zou
entries.publication: Taibei: Taiwan min zu zhi ying xiang xue hui, [2005]167 p.
entries.note: This bilingual (Chinese and English) work was published for the 2nd Taiwan International Ethnographic Film Festival: Family Variations, in 2005. Includes festival program and an introduction to the presented films.

entries.authorc: [臺灣民族誌影像學會主辦] ; 中央研究院民族學研究所等協辦
entries.authorp: [Taiwan min zu zhi ying xiang xue hui zhu ban]; Zhong yang yan jiu yuan min zu xue yan jiu suo deng xie ban.
entries.title: Suffering and rebirth : Taiwan international ethnographic film festival
entries.titlec: 試煉與重生 : 2011台灣國際民族誌影展特刊
entries.titlep: Shi lian yu chong sheng: 2011 Taiwan guo ji min zu zhi ying zhan te kan
entries.publication: Taibei: Taiwan min zu zhi ying xiang xue hui, 2011.
entries.note: This bilingual (Chinese and English) work was published for the 6th Taiwan International Ethnographic Film Festival: Suffering and Rebirth, in 2011. Includes festival program and an introduction to the presented films.

entries.authorp: Taiwan xing bie ren quan xie hui.
entries.title: Asian Lesbian Film and Video Festival
entries.titlec: 2005 女同志的盛夏派對亞洲拉子影展
entries.titlep: 2005 nu tong zhi de sheng xia pai dui Yazhou La Zi ying zhan
entries.publication: [Taibei: Taiwan xing bie ren quan xie hui,  2005].
entries.note: Program fom the 1st Asian Lesbian Film and Video Festival held in Taipei, Taiwan in 2005, including the Taiwanese lesbian films shown during the festival.

entries.title: Young line - a genre analysis of 2002-2008 Taiwan gay and lesbian movies.
entries.titlec: 青春系列 – 從類型觀點看2002-2008 台灣同志電影
entries.titlep: Qing chun xi lie – cong lei xing guan dian kan 2002-2008 Taiwan tong zhi dian ying
entries.note: Thesis (M.A.) – Taiwan Chengchi University, 2009.A genre study of a series of Taiwan gay films; explores their characteristics, development, culture, and other contextual factors. Concludes that the “Young Line” series is inspired by the concepts and techniques of foreign films, but at the same time, the series inherits the core traditional themes of local films of the same genre; thus, the series achieves a particular inclusive style. This genre of film arrived while Taiwan’s film industry was at a low ebb. The success of this series reveals a grassroots force that is leading the rebound of the Taiwan film industry.Includes Chinese & English Abstract and Bibliography.

entries.authorc: 策劃執行單位: 台灣電影文化協會.
entries.authorp: Ce hua zhi xing dan wei: Taiwan dian ying wen hua xie hui.
entries.title: Chinese Phanton Film Festival
entries.titlep: Gui mei ying zhan
entries.publication: Taibei: Taiwan dian ying wen hua xie hui, 2004.
entries.note: A special publication for the Chinese Phanton Film Festival hosted by the Taiwan Film and Culture Association from Oct. 2004-Nov. 2004 in Taiwan. Includes a special article in memory of Taiwan ghost film director Yao Feng-pan and his filmography, synopses of twenty eight Chinese phantom films from mainland China, Taiwan, and Hong Kong that represent two time periods: 1937-1987 and 1991-2004, special introductions to Hong Kong film director Xu Anhua’s three phantom films and four films based on the same ghost story directed by different directors, and nine essays by Taiwan and Hong Kong scholars on Chinese phantom films.Includes a limited filmography of Chinese ghost films made from 1956-2004 by Wen Tianxiang.

entries.author: Chou, Peggy.
entries.titlep: Taiwan cinema: fictions, documentaries, animations.
entries.publication: Taipei: Department of Motion Picture Affairs, Government Information Office, 2006.
entries.note: According to OCLC WorldCat, there is only one copy at the National Taiwan University Library.

entries.title: Innovation or recycling: Mandarin classics and the return of the wenyi tradition.
entries.publication: Hong Kong: David C. Lam Institute for East-West Studies, Hong Kong Baptist University, 2006.
entries.seriesTitle: Working paper series (David C Lam Institute for East-West Studies; No. 47.
entries.note: A paper presented at “Film Style in Question : an International Symposium in Honor of David Bordwell” at University of Wisconsin, Madison, April 21-23, 2005. Discusses the representation of Mandarin literary classics in 21st century Taiwan cinema.Includes Bibliography.

entries.titlep: Ciné kung fu
entries.publication: Paris: Ramsay,­ 1988.
entries.note: An introduction to the historical development of kung fu films in mainland China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, and the World, as well as King Hu, Bruce Lee,  Jackie Chan, and Jet Li. Divided into four parts: 1. From Martial Arts to Kung Fu Films; 2. Golden Era of  Martial Arts Films (1965-1971); 3. Prosperous Period of Kung Fu Films (1971-1975); and 4. New Wave (1975-1981).Includes Geneology Chart of Shaolin Tample, Bibliography, and Index.

entries.titlec: 刀光侠影蒙太奇：中国武侠电影论。
entries.titlep: Dao guang xia ying meng tai qi: Zhongguo wu xia dian ying lun.
entries.publication: Beijing: Zhongguo dian ying chu ban she, 1996.
entries.note: A major work on Chinese martial arts films by mainland Chinese film  scholar Chen Mo. However, according to the author’s postscript, the author could only access martial arts films located in the Chinese Film Archive in Beijing, but not those in Hong Kong or the Chinese Taipei Film Archive in Taipei when he was writing the book; thus, the Hong Kong and Taiwan martial arts film sections in the book can not be seen as comprehensive. There is no explanation for the interruption of martial arts film development in mainland China after 1949. Another missing aspect of the book is the absence of a Chinese martial arts filmography.Includes Bibliography.

entries.titlep: Zhongguo wu xia dian ying shi.
entries.publication: Beijing: Zhongguo dian ying chu ban she, 2005.
entries.seriesTitle: Bai nian Zhongguo dian ying yan jiu shu xi百年中国电影研究书系
entries.note: As a comprehensive work on Chinese martial arts film history, this text maintains a fairly objective overview of martial arts film development in mainland China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, and overseas. Relatively speaking, the author’s knowledge of mainland China and Hong Kong martial arts films is more in-depth that his assessment of Taiwan martial arts films. It is unforturnate that there is no Chinese martial arts filmography in the book.Includes Bibliography.

entries.titlec: 武之舞：中国武侠电影的形态与神魂。
entries.titlep: Wu zhi wu: Zhongguo wu xia dian ying de xing tai yu shen hun.
entries.publication: Zhengzhou: Henan ren min chu ban she, 1998.
entries.seriesTitle: Yu le wen hua yan jiu cong shu娱乐文化研究丛书
entries.note: An early attempt by the mainland China scholar to explore common themes within martial arts films produced in mainland China, Hong Kong, and Taiwan. However, the  book can not be viewed as a serious academic work due to the fact that the author did not have direct access to resources in Taiwan, such as the resources at the Chinese Taipei Film Archive, and thus did not attain a sufficient quantity of reliable primary sources to support his assertions.Includes a filmography of the famous Chinese martial arts figure Huang Feihong (Wong Fei-Hung) from 1949-1994, but there is no bibliography.

entries.titlep: Zhongguo wu xia dian ying shi.
entries.publication: Beijing: Wen hua yi shu chu ban she, 2005.
entries.seriesTitle: Dian ying cong shu电影丛书
entries.note: A Chinese martial arts film history. The author provides a detailed chronology of Chinese martial arts films as the genre moved through mainland China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, and overseas. However, the author does not provide a convincing reason for the abrupt interruption of martial arts film development in mainland China after 1949.Includes interviews with contemporary Chinese martial arts film directors and actors.Includes Bibliography.

entries.titlec: 旁落的江湖：中国武侠电影的历史与审美。
entries.titlep: Pang luo de jiang hu: Zhongguo wu xia dian ying de li shi yu shen mei.
entries.publication: Beijing: Zhongguo you yi chu ban gong si, 2008.
entries.note: A general introduction to Chinese martial arts film history and its aesthetic meaning. While the author mentions Taiwan martial arts films, his limited knowledge of, and access to, Taiwan martial art films is apparent.Includes Filmography and Bibliography.

entries.authorp: Bill Palmer, Karen Palmer, and Ric Meyers.
entries.title: The encyclopedia of martial arts movies
entries.publication: Metuchen, N.J.: Scarecrow Press, 1995.
entries.note: Provides 3,281 entries on martial arts films produced mainly in Hong Kong, Taiwan, Japan, the United States, and China with film information including the title, cast, director, producer, film studio, runtime, and availability. The major problems with the text are as follows: only English translations are used for all non-English films, and the names of Chinese cast members are often romanized in nonstandard ways. For example, famous Chinese martial arts film star Jet Li is presented as “Li Lianjie,” which is the standard Pinyin romanization system of his name, or “Li Lien-chieh,” his name in the standard Wade-Giles Romanization system. However, Jet Li’s name, in this work, is: “Li Lin-jei.” Jet Li’s popular, non-standard English name, “Jat Lee,” is provided in the Aliases section. Includes bibliographical references (p. 417), aliases, and a name index.

entries.title: The martial arts cinema of the Chinese diaspora: Ang Lee, John Woo, and Jackie Chan in Hollywood.
entries.publication: Carbondale: Southern Illinois University Press,ISBN	9780809330218 (pbk. : alk. paper); 0809330210 (pbk. : alk. paper); 9780809386208 (ebook); 0809386208 (ebook)
entries.note: A work on Ang Lee, John Woo, Jackie Chan, and their martial arts film careers in Hollywood.

entries.title: The secret of Kong Fu movie: the arts of action director.
entries.titlec: 功夫片的秘密：动作导演艺术
entries.titlep: Gong fu pian de mi mi: dong zuo dao yan yi shu
entries.publication: Qingdao: Qingdao chu ban she, 2009.
entries.note: A work on the art of Chinese martial arts film developed in mainland China, Hong Kong, and Taiwan. Covers multiple aspects, such as special effects, martial arts training, directing skills, equipment, acting, etc. Pays primary attention to Hong Kong martial arts film directors and actors.Includes Bibliography, and the Nominees for best action design in martial arts films for Hong Kong Film Awards and Golden Horse Awards in Taiwan.

entries.titlep: You yuan jing meng
entries.publication: Guangzhou: Hua cheng chu ben she, 2000.
entries.seriesTitle: Bai Xianyong wen ji  di wu juan  xi ju, dian ying白先勇文集：第五卷：戏剧，电影
entries.note: A collection of essays by Bai Xianyong on opera films.

entries.title: Taiwan cinema 2000-2002: short fictions, documentaries, animations, experimentals
entries.publication: Taipei: Arthur Lap, 2003.
entries.note: An introduction to Taiwan cinema from 2000-2002; includes: short films, documentaries, animation, and experimental cinema.

entries.title: Deconstruction of Teenager-Campus Films in the 80’s: Genre, gender and national identity.
entries.titlec: 解構八十年代校園學生電影: 類型, 性別, 國族認同
entries.titlep: Jie gou ba shi nian dai xiao yuan xue sheng dian ying: Lei xing, xing bie, guo zu ren tong
entries.note: Thesis (M.A.) – Tamkang University, 2007.Analyzes four coming-of-age films produced in the 1980s that represent teenagers growing up on campuses. Identifies the ways teenagers become socialized and gradually conform to the masculine stereotypes expected of them as they are raised by authoritative male figures within a patriarchal society. The comradery forged among the male teenagers arguably represents the comradery among citizens of the nation as a whole within the national imaginary.Includes Chinese & English Abstract, Bibliography, and Charts of the Films Produced in the 1980s.

entries.titlec: 電影未死 – 101 套好好戲.
entries.titlep: Dian ying wei si – 101 tao hao hao xi.
entries.publication: Xianggang: Kubrick, 2005.
entries.note: A collection of the author’s film reviews, including reviews of Taiwan films directed by Yi Zhiyan, Hou Hsiao-hsien, and Edward Yang.

entries.titlec: 愛情故事電影集 (男人篇).
entries.titlep: Ai qing gu shi dian ying ji (nan ren pian).
entries.publication: Taibei xian Xindian shi: Xue ying wen hua shi ye you xian gong si, 1998.
entries.seriesTitle: Ai qing gu shi zhi 1愛情故事之 1
entries.note: A collection of film reviews, primarily on Taiwan romantic films, written from a feminist perspective.

entries.title: Ning shi xin ling: wen xue dian ying yu ren sheng.
entries.titlec: 凝視心靈: 文學電影與人生.
entries.publication: Taibei: Xiu wei zi xun ke ji gu fen you xian gong si, 2010.
entries.seriesTitle: Mei xue yi shu lei; PH 0022美學藝術類; PH 0022
entries.note: Reviews films from mainland China, Hong Kong, and Taiwan.Includes Bibliography.

entries.titlec: 惡聲 - 陳克華電影筆記.
entries.titlep: E sheng - Chen Kehua dian ying bi ji.
entries.publication: Taibei: Huang guan wen xue chu ban you xian gong si, 1994.
entries.seriesTitle: Huang guan cong shu di er san qi san zhong皇冠叢書第二三七三種
entries.note: A collection of the author’s film reviews primarily on Taiwan films.

entries.titlec: 夢影集 – 中國電影印象.
entries.titlep: Meng ying ji – Zhongguo dian ying yin xiang.
entries.publication: Taibei: Yun chen wen hua shi ye gu fen you xian gong si, 1990.
entries.seriesTitle: Yun chen wen xuan 10允晨文選 10
entries.note: A collection of film reviews on mainland China, Hong Kong, and Taiwan films. Four reviews (pp. 253-276) focus on Taiwan films.

entries.author: Chen, Nianxuan.
entries.titlep: Wo ai shuo dian ying.
entries.publication: Taibei: Zhi ku go fen you xian gong si, 2005.
entries.seriesTitle: Xiu xian sheng huo; 8休閑生活; 8
entries.note: A collection of film reviews divided by region; includes two Taiwan film reviews in the “China, Hong Kong, and Taiwan” region.

entries.author: Chen, Yaocheng (Evans Yiu Shing Chan).
entries.title: From the new wave to the postmodern.
entries.titlep: Cong xin lang chao zhi hou xian dai
entries.publication: Xianggang: Xianggang dian ying ping lun xue hui, 2001.
entries.seriesTitle: Xianggang dian ying ping lun xue hui cong shu 11香港電影評論學會叢書 11
entries.note: A collection of the author’s film reviews and essays on film studies; Chapter 4 includes a segment on Taiwan.Includes Index.

entries.author: edited by Chris Berry.
entries.title: Chinese films in focus: 25 new takers
entries.publication: London: BFI Pub., 2003.
entries.note: A collection of the essays on 25 Chinese films, including the essays on the  following Taiwanese films: “Flowers of Shanghai : visualising ellipses and (colonial) absence” by Gang Gary Xu; “A time to live, a time to die : a time to grow” by Corrado Neri; “A touch of Zen : action in martial arts movies” by Mary Farquhar; “Vive l'amour : eloquent emptiness” by Fran Martin; “Wedding banquet : a family (melodrama) affair” by Chris Berry; and “Yi yi : reflections on reflexive modernity in Taiwan” by David Leiwei Li.Includes Bibliography and Index.

entries.author: edited by Chris Berry.
entries.title: Chinese films in focus II
entries.publication: Basingstoke, Hampshire, UK; New York: Palgrave Macmillan; London: on behalf of British Film Institute, 2008.
entries.note: An enhanced version of Chinese films in focus: 25 new takes published in 200, and an essential guide to key Chinese films from the 1930s to the present in China, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Singapore, and other areas. In addition to the essays published in the earlier book, 14 new articles were added, including a new article dealing with Taiwan cinema: “Formula 17: mainstream in the margins” by film scholar Brian Hu.Includes Bibliography and Index.

entries.titlep: Dian ying xin chao.
entries.publication: Taibei: Shi bao wen hua chu ban shi ye you xian gong si, 1976.
entries.seriesTitle: 時報書系 27
entries.note: The author’s articles on and reviews of current world-wide film trends, including Taiwan.

entries.titlep: Dian ying su miao.
entries.publication: Taibei: Xiu wei zi xun ke ji go fen you xian gong si, 2007.
entries.note: A collection of the author’s film reviews, including the reviews of films produced in Taiwan, Hong Kong, and mainland China.

entries.title: New Taiwanese cinema, the year 1986, an identity in the making.
entries.note: Thesis (M.A.)—San Francisco State University, 1995.This thesis focuses on two Taiwanese directors, Hou Hsiao-hsien and Edward Yang as well as their films Dust in the Wind and Terrorizers, both of which were made in 1986. Describes the ways these two directors and their films have left an indelible mark on Taiwan New Cinema.Includes Bibliography.
subjects: Taiwan New, New-New, and Post-New Cinema, 1982-

entries.titlep: Zhuan dong zhong de dian ying shi jie.
entries.publication: Taibei: Zhi wen chu ban she, 1980.
entries.seriesTitle: Xin chao wen ku 234新潮文庫 234

entries.note: A book in four parts: 1: Introduction of the film director Wang Qizai and his production team; 2. A collection of film-making stories; 3. Introduction of the film cast; and 4. A review of the film: Formosa Mambo (2011).

entries.title: A world of sadness.
entries.note: A manuscript on Hou Hsiao-hsien’s film A City of Sadness (1989). Received the Susan Anthony Potter Price in Comparative Literature, Harvard University, 1997.
subjects: Taiwan New, New-New, and Post-New Cinema, 1982-

entries.title: A city of sadness
entries.publication: London: British Film Institute, 2002.
entries.seriesTitle: BFI Modern Classics
entries.note: a comprehensive study of Hou Hsiao-hsien’s film A City of Sadness (1989). Integrates unique perspectives, such as a comparative analysis of the June 4th Incident in Tiananment Square in Beijing in 1989 and the film; historical background of the Lin family in the film, and a detailed study of the film’s sound editing strategy and effects.Includes, as Appendix, the Lin Family Genealogy chart, Filmography, Notes, and Film Credits.

Includes the introduction to the original story depicted in the film, discussions of the film’s historical context including brothels in Shanghai, use of Shanghainese, casting, stand out performances, setting, and film reviews.Includes film stills and photos.NTUL										ChiHao nan hao nu = Good Men, Good Women (1993)好男好女 （1993）0850Zhu, Tianwen (Chu, T’ien-wen), 1956-朱天文, 1956-Bei qing cheng shi.悲情城市。Shanghai: Shanghai wen yi chu ban she, 2001.248 p.ISBN	7532121003Series title:	Tai Gang ji hai wai Hua yu zuo jia zi xuan wen ku台港暨海外作家自选文库
entries.note: A collection of 4 screenplays written by the author and directed by Hou Hsiao-hsien: Dust in the Wind (1986), A City of Sadness (1989), The Puppetmaster (1993), and Good Men, Good Women (1995), as well as the author’s comments and records of making the films.Includes Filmography and Bibliography.

entries.author: Edited by David Gallagher.
entries.title: World cinema and the visual arts
entries.publication: New York: Amthem Press, 2012.
entries.note: A collection of academic essays on world cinema, including: “The postnational and the aesthetics of the spectral: Hou Hsiao-Hsien's Flight of the red balloon” by Je Cheol Park.Includes Bibliography and Index.

entries.note: Primarily a discussion of the film: Ji mo fang xin ju le bu / Lonely Hearts Club; however, at the end, films directed by Ang Lee and Tsai Ming-liang are reviewed.

entries.titlep: Ka fei shi guang, suo yin
entries.publication: Taibei: San shi duo mei ti wang lu go fen you xiang gong si, 2004.
entries.note: A special publication for Hou Hsiao-hsien’s 2003 film Ka fei shi guang (Café Lumière). The literal translation of the film is “coffee time”. Commissioned by the Japanese film studio, Shochiku; includes the film’s background story, credits, and an index.

entries.authorp: Bian zhuan: Xin xian wen hua.

entries.note: A pictorial book that presents the making of the film Step By Step (2009), directed by Guo Zhendi. Includes photos, selected film stills, and interviews with the director, producer, cast, and cinematographers.

entries.titlep: Rolling.
entries.note: Thesis (M.A.) – National Taiwan University of Arts, 2006.The paper explores the concept, creation process, structure and design, and retrospective analysis of the documentary film Island Etude (2007).Includes Chinese & English Abstract,  Bibliography, and Appendix (including Film Shooting Specifications, Budgets, Production Timetable, Crew Member Biographies, Survey Sample, Survey Analysis, and Stills).

entries.titlep: Liu li dao ying
entries.publication: Taibei: Tangshan, 2001.
entries.note: A record of a documentary film project from 1999-2000 in which twelve film directors visited twelve islands surrounding Taiwan in order to make twelve documentary films about these islands. Includes a discussion of the project’s initial concept, and a history of the island’s people, culture, and environment.Includes photos.

entries.titlec: 一起參加, 沒參加電影主題書

entries.note: An account of a short documentary film made in 2000, directed by Liu Jixiong and Liu Jianwei, about a dog adoption in Taiwan; includes an introduction by the film directors, a description of making the film, technical details of the film, and film reviews.

entries.titlec: 魔法阿媽: 我把阿媽辯卡通了
entries.titlep: Mo fa a ma: wo ba a ma bian ka tong le

entries.titlec: 千禧曼波電影筆記: 侯孝賢的電影.

entries.publication: Taibei: Mai tian chu ban, 2001.
entries.seriesTitle: Sheng huo yue du, 24生活閱讀, 24
entries.note: An account of Hou Hsiao-hsien’s film Millennium Mambo (2001) by the film’s embedded recorder. Contains film scenes with accompanying script segments, film stills, background information, setting locations, addresses and contact information, and interviews with the director, cast, cinematographer, musicians, and artistic advisor.

entries.title: "Taiwan Black Movies" - The Making and Meaning of a Documentary.
entries.titlec: “台灣黑電影” 紀錄片之創作與意義
entries.titlep: “Taiwan Hei Dian Ying” ji lu pian zhi chuang zuo yu yi yi
entries.note: Thesis (M.A.) – National Chengchi University, 2005.Using  “Social Realistic Movies”, popular during the early 1980s, as a primary reference point, the author makes a documentary film entitled: Taiwan Black Movies (2005). This paper records the production and meaning of “Taiwan Black Movies”.Includes Chinese & English Abstract, Bibliography, Chronology of “Social Realistic Movies” 1975-1985, Filmography of “Social Realistic Movies” 1975-1985, Interviews, Reviews of “Taiwan Black Cinema”, Copyright Agreement, Script of Taiwan Black Movies, and Hou Jiran’s Professional Biography.

entries.note: The author, a film director and screenwriter, presents his persectives on film theory and world cinema, including Taiwan cinema.

entries.seriesTitle: Xian ren zhang wen ku 20仙人掌文庫 20
entries.note: An introduction to film theory,  techniques, and world cinema.

entries.titlep: Xian dai dian ying yi shu.

entries.note: A general introduction to film theory and techniques.Includes a Japanese screenplay: Harakiri (Kobayashi Masaki, 1962).

entries.titlep: Dian ying yuan li yu zhi zuo.
entries.publication: Taibei: San min shu ju, 1982.

entries.titlep: Dian ying fu bi xing ji.
entries.publication: Xianggang: Tian di tu shu you xian gong si, 1991.
entries.note: Essays on subjects such as Chinese film history from the 1920s -40s, a comparative study of Hong Kong and Taiwan films, film theory, and Taiwan and Hong Kong film directors and their films.

entries.titlep: Dian ying lu tan.
entries.publication: Taibei: Zhongguo ying ping ren xie hui, 1979.
entries.note: A collection of author’s articles and studies on Taiwan film, followed by film reviews.

entries.titlep: Dian ying, Zhongguo, Meng.
entries.publication: Taibei: Shi bao wen hua chu ban qi ye you xian gong si, 1990.
entries.seriesTitle: Ren jian cong shu 106人間叢書 106
entries.note: Contains three parts: 1) a collection of articles on film theory; 2) a comparative study of Western and Taiwan films; and 3), a study of new Taiwan film directors and their films.Includes Chronology.

entries.titlep: Dian ying chen si ji.
entries.publication: Taibei: Yuan shen chu ban she, 1987.
entries.seriesTitle: Yuan shen cong shu 20圓神叢書 20
entries.note: A collection of film related articles originally published in various newspapers and journals; divided into the following four parts: Movements, Structure, Criticism, and Appendix. Articles on Taiwan film are present in all four parts of the book.

entries.titlep: Dian ying fu hao xue.
entries.publication: Taibei: Shu lin chu ban you xian gong si, 1992.
entries.seriesTitle: Dian ying cong shu; 1電影叢書; 1
entries.note: The author both introduces readers to, and reviews key elements of, the development of La semiologie du cinema film theory initiated by French scholar Christian Metz in 1964, then applies said theory to the study of Taiwan film directors including Edward Yang, Hou Hsiao-hsien, and Chen Guofu. Includes Glossary in French, English, and Chinese; Name and Film Title List in both the original language and Chinese translation; and Name and Film Title Index organized according to Chinese character stroke numbers.

entries.titlep: Dian ying yi shu lun.
entries.publication: Taibei: San shan chu ban she, 1964.
entries.seriesTitle: San shan cong shu; er三山叢書; 二
entries.note: A general introduction to world cinema in terms of film art and film production; while the text does not mention Taiwan film production, the book concludes with a commentary on the artistic relationship between Chinese poetry, characters, and film.

entries.titlep: Ji lu pian zhi zhi zuo.
entries.publication: Taibei: Shi jie shu ju, 1978.
entries.note: This is the same work published in 1965 under the name of Wenquan (Chen, Wenquan) with a similar title. An introduction to documentary film theory and a detailed description of the techniques and processes of documentary film-making in Taiwan.Appendix includes three papers on documentary films by Xiao Hao.

entries.titlep: Dian ying gai lun.
entries.publication: Taibei: Guo li xi ju zhuan ge xue xiao xiao you hui, 1961.
entries.note: A general introduction to film, its origins, film theory, film art, film education, screenplay-writing, directing, and further topics. While Wenquan is presented as the author’s name in the book, the author’s real name is Chen, Wenquan

entries.titlec: 紀錄片攝製之理論與實踐.
entries.titlep: Ji lu pian she zhi zhi li lun yu shi jian.
entries.publication: Taibei: Zhong wai dian ying za zhi she, 1965.
entries.note: An introduction to documentary film theory and a detailed description of the techniques and processes of documentary film-making in Taiwan.Appendix includes three papers on documentary films by Xiao Hao.

entries.titlep: Dian ying yu chuan bo.
entries.publication: Taibei: Li ming wen hua shi ye gu fen you xian gong si, 1979.
entries.note: A collection of the author’s articles on film production and distribution, the relationship between literature and film, the Chinese communist influence on film production, Taiwan film history, and the rise and fall of Taiwanese-dialect film.Includes Bibliography.

entries.titlep: Ying guang mu hou.
entries.publication: Taibei: Xing zheng yuan wen hua jian she wei yuan hui, 1986.
entries.seriesTitle: Wen hua jian she cong shu; 7文化建設叢書; 7
entries.note: A collection of the author’s articles dealing with film and TV production and direction in Taiwan.

entries.titlep: Zai dian ying si kao de nian dai.
entries.publication: Taibei: Shu lin chu ban you xian gong si, 2007.
entries.seriesTitle: Dian ying yuan; F4電影苑; F4
entries.note: The author uses the lens of various film theories to review and analyse Edward Yang films as well as the films of Alfred Hitchcock and other famous western film directors.Includes Bibliography.

entries.titlep: Dian ying si kao:
entries.publication: Taibei: Guang fu shu ju, 1988.
entries.seriesTitle: Chun hui cong shu 24春暉叢書 24
entries.note: A collection of author’s articles on film theory and film reviews; very few mention Taiwan film.

entries.titlec: 影像地誌學: 邁向電影空間理論的建構.
entries.titlep: Ying xiang di zhi xue: mai xiang dian ying kong jian li lun de jian gou.
entries.publication: Taibei: Wan xiang tu shu ge fen you xian gong si, 1996.
entries.seriesTitle: Yi shu fang 28藝書房 28
entries.note: The author aims to establish an original theory of film space by considering related film theories and analyzing relevant films.Includes Bibliography and Index.

entries.titlep: Xi ju lun ji.
entries.publication: Taibei: Taiwan kai ming shu dian, 1969.
entries.note: A collection of the author’s essays on drama and film theory.

entries.title: The moving image
entries.titlep: Ying xiang bi ji
entries.publication: Tainan: Tainan yi shu da xue, 2007.
entries.note: A collection of film studies essays and lectures presented at Tainan National University of the Arts. Divided into four parts: Part 1: Principle of Moving Image and Aesthetics, Part 2: Moving Image Culture and Communication, Part 3: Moving Image Today and Tomorrow, and Part 4: Moving Image Creation. In terms of specifics, Part 1 touches on current (2007) Taiwan film theory discussions; Part 2 focuses on Taiwan film history; Part 3 considers the future of Taiwan film development, and Part 4 presents film-making anecdotes and experiences from Taiwan.

entries.titlep: Dian ying jian shang yu chuang yi.
entries.publication: Taibei xian Zhonghe shi: Xin wen jing kai fa chu ban gu fen you xian gong si,2007.
entries.note: Introduces film history, art, theory, techniques, production, and appreciation.Includes Bibliography.

entries.title: Talks on cinematic art.
entries.titlep: Dian ying yi shu za tan
entries.publication: Taibei: Chen zhong chu ban she, 1970.
entries.seriesTitle: Xiang ri kui wen cong 3向日葵文叢 3
entries.note: A collection of the author’s discussions on cinematic art. The first articles in the text discuss contemporary Taiwan film, its achievements and shortcomings.

entries.titlep: Biao yan lun.
entries.publication: Taibei: Huang guan chu ban she, 1973.
entries.note: Presents Chinese and Western drama acting techniques and theory with the belief that these concepts are also applicable to film performance.

entries.titlep: Tan yan ji.
entries.publication: Taibei: Hai tian chu ban she, 1960.
entries.note: A text that presents acting techniques.

entries.titlep: Biao yan yi shu.
entries.publication: Taibei: Zheng zhong shu ju, 1973.
entries.seriesTitle: Zheng zhong wen yi cong shu正中文藝叢書
entries.note: A collection of the essays on drama and movie acting.

entries.titlec: 中国电影表演百年史话。
entries.titlep: Zhongguo dian ying biao yan bai nian shi hua.
entries.publication: Beijing: Zhongguo dian ying chu ban she, 2005.
entries.note: A summary of 100 years of Chinese film acting history and development. Chapter 6 (pp. 191-222) surveys 50 years (1950-2000) of film acting in Hong Kong and Taiwan.

entries.titlep: Yan yuan xun lian jiang yi.
entries.publication: Taibei: Hua lian chu ban she, 1979.
entries.note: An outline for teaching drama and film acting in workshops or in the classroom.Includes a glossary.

entries.titlep: Ying ju yan ji zhi fang.
entries.publication: Taibei: Xia Peng, 1968.
entries.note: An overview of the skills, training, and techniques of acting necessary for movie, television, and drama performance, presented in twelve chapters.

entries.titlec: 電影演員基本練習 – 自修講義.
entries.titlep: Dian ying yan yuan ji ben lian xi – zi xiu jiang yi.
entries.publication: Taibei: Liu feng chu ban she, 1968.
entries.note: A self-study guide for film actors and actresses, with basic information regarding acting, make-up, mise-en-scène, equipment, terminology, and the film-making process.

entries.titlep: Dian ying yue du mei xue.
entries.publication: Taibei: Shu lin chu ban you xian gong si, 1993.
entries.note: An accessible introduction to film aesthetics and theory; includes close readings of film scenes, including scenes from Taiwan films.

entries.titlec: 電影閱讀美學 (增訂三版).
entries.titlep: Dian ying yue du mei xue (zeng ding san ban).
entries.publication: Taibei: Shu lin chu ban you xian gong si, 2006.
entries.note: An accessible introduction to film aesthetics and theory, originally published in 1993. Compared with the 2nd edition, the 3rd edition contains additional reviews of concurrent foreign and mainland Chinese films.Includes Bibliography and Film Index.

entries.titlep: Ying shi li lun yu pi ping.
entries.publication: Taibei: Wu nan tu shu chu ban go fen you xian gong si, 2005.
entries.note: A collection of essays and divided into two parts: Part 1) “Theory”, an introduction to film theory and various film schools, and Part 2)  “Criticism”, a collection of the author’s critical essays and film analyses.

entries.title: A comparative study of movie aesthetics between Ang Lee’s “Brokeback Mountain” and Yimou Zhang’s “House of flying daggers”.

entries.titlec: 三月後的五卷 – 愛欲辨證與電影美學.

entries.seriesTitle: Sophia; 5
entries.note: While the title, and chapter four, both mention “film aesthetics,” in fact this text could be more accurately described as a work at the intersection of philosophy, critical theory, and film.Include the author’s Chronology.

entries.author: Zong ce hua Chen Jimin.
entries.title: Taiwan documentary aesthetic series
entries.titlep: Taiwan ji lu pian mei xue xi lie
entries.publication: Taizhong: Guo li Taiwan mei shu guan, 2008.
entries.note: This study is the result of a project entitled the “Taiwan Documentary Aesthetic Series,” hosted by the National Taiwan Museum of Fine Arts in 2008. Examines multiple topics while providing the history of Taiwan documentary films in a systematic way. Five Taiwan documentary film studies scholars were invited to act as curators for the project, and each scholar presents his/her perspective on the development of Taiwan documentary film aesthetics in this work.Vol. 1: “A pre-history of Taiwanese documentary filmmaking: actualities, home movies and documentary”, curated by Liao Gene-fon, covers early documentary films from the 1930s to the 1970s.Vol. 2: “Hegemony and the aesthetic of Taiwan documentary film in the early post-Martial Law era”, curated by Lin Bao-yuan, reviews challenges to the hegemony and the aesthetic development of documentary films from 1985-1999 (Martial Law was lifted in 1987).Vol. 3: “Private me time: I and my …”, curated by Wen Tien-hsiang, describes the arrival of “Private me time” in Taiwan documentary films from 1990-2008.

entries.authorp: Lin Zanting diao cha yu yan jiu.

entries.titlep: Dian ying dao yan.

entries.note: The text presents 10 chapters that introduce general film directing approaches, skills and techniques. This work is listed in a memorial publication entitled: Bai Ke dao yan ji nian wen ji ji yi zuo xuan ji (edited by Huang Ren in 2003), but the text can not be found in the major film libraries in Taiwan, including the Chinese Taipei Film Archive Library, National Central Library, and National Taiwan University Library.

entries.note: A general introduction to directing techniques for film, drama, and television. Chapters that deal with cinema include the following: Chapter 4 discusses representative traits of various film genres and movements; Chapters 5-24 introduce nineteen basic directing techniques; Chapter 26 provides specific techniques for feature film production.

subjects: Taiwan New, New-New, and Post-New Cinema, 1982-

entries.authorc: 陳儒修作; 羅頗誠譯.
entries.authorp: Chen Ruxiu zuo; Luo Pocheng yi.
entries.titlec: 台灣新電影的歷史文化經驗
entries.titlep: Taiwan xin dian ying de li shi wen hua jing yan
entries.publication: Taipei: Wan xiang tu shu gong si, 1993.
entries.seriesTitle: Taiwan dian ying shi cong shu; 1台灣電影史叢書; 1
entries.note: This is the Chinese translation of Robert Chen’s Ph.D. dissertation completed in 1993 at Southern California University.  The author explores the relationship between Taiwan New Cinema and three cultural characteristics: “Dispersion”, “Ambivalence”, and “Hybridity.” Divided into eight chapters: Chapter 1: Research Project Introduction; Chapter 2: History of Taiwan Film Industry and Style Development; Chapter 3: Taiwanese Identity; Chapter 4: Major Events of Taiwan New Cinema; Chapter 5: Taiwan’s Modern Experience; Chapter 6: Male and Female Characters in Taiwan Film; Chapter 7: Influence of Hollywood and Other Areas Films; and Chapter 8: Meaning of Taiwan New Cinema.Includes Biographies of major figures and Introductions of major works in Taiwan New Cinema, and Bibliography.
subjects: Taiwan New, New-New, and Post-New Cinema, 1982-

entries.titlec: 電影, 電影人, 電影刊物
entries.titlep: Dian ying, dian ying ren, dian ying kan wu
entries.publication: Taibei: Zi li wan bao she, 1986.
entries.seriesTitle: Dian ying wen xuan, 2電影文選, 2Zi li cong shu, 27自立叢書, 27
entries.note: A Taiwan New Cinema book. Originally published in various journals, books, and newspapers, this collection of the articles and essays focuses on Taiwan's film history, film journals, film reviews, filmmakers and film critiques from the early period of Taiwan New Cinema. The most unique and important aspect of this book is the editor’s insightful comments, interpretations, and background information provided after each article or essay. Includes film stills.
subjects: Taiwan New, New-New, and Post-New Cinema, 1982-

entries.title: Rethinking the film critics’ role of Taiwan New Cinema in the 1980s.

entries.author: edited by Chris Berry and Feii Lu.
entries.title: Island on the edge: Taiwan New Cinema and after
entries.publication: Hong Kong: Hong Kong University Press, 2005.
entries.note: A collection of essays focusing on the Taiwan New Cinema studies:The Terrorizer and the great divide in contemporary Taiwan's cultural development / Sung-sheng Yvonne Chang; Reflections on the screen : Hou Hsiao Hsien's Dust in the Wind and the rhythms of the Taiwan New Cinema / Haden Guest; A Borrowed Life in Banana Paradise : de-Cold War/decolonization, or modernity and its tears / Chen Kuan-Hsing; Hou Hsiao Hsien's City of Sadness : history and the dialogic female voice / Rosemary Haddon; Myth(ology) mythologizing its own closure : Edward Yang's A Brighter Summer Day / Liu Yu-hsiu; Hou Hsiao Hsien's The Puppetmaster : the poetics of landscape / Nick Browne; Where is the love? : hyperbolic realism and indulgence in Vive L’Amour / Chris Berry; Generational/cultural contradiction and global incorporation: Ang Lee's Eat Drink Man Woman / Ti Wei; On Tsai Mingliang's The River / Gina Marchetti -- Compulsory orientalism : Hou Hsiao Hsien's Flowers of Shanghai / Nick Kaldis; Another cinema : Darkness & Light / Feii Lu;  China simulacrum : genre, feminism, and Pan-Chinese cultural politics in Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon / Fran Martin.
subjects: Taiwan New, New-New, and Post-New Cinema, 1982-

entries.title: Discursive formation of “Taiwanese New Cinema”: a historical analysis (1965-2000).
entries.titlec: 台灣 “新電影” 論述形構之歷史分析 (1965-2000)
entries.titlep: Taiwan “Xin dian ying” lun shu xing gou zhi li shi fen xi (1965-2000)
entries.note: Thesis (M.A.) – National Chengchi University, 2001.Analyzes the discursive formation of Taiwan New Cinema, the influence of Western Art Cinema on Taiwan New Cinema, and the historical relationship between Taiwan New Cinema and the popular Golden Horse Awards. Also covers traditional topics in the field: the disconnect between Taiwan New Cinema and the local film industry, the government's transition from passive involvement in the 1980s to active involvement in the 1990s, the establishment of the Guidance Fund for Domestically Produced Films and participation in international film festivals, and the decline of Taiwan's film industry in the 1990s.Includes Chinese Abstract, Bibliography, and Charts of International and Domestic Box Office Records of Hou Hsiao-hsien and Edward Yang’s Films (1983-1988), Percentage of the Domestically Produced Films that were sent for Censorship and Received the Guidance Fund (1980-1999), and Films that Received the Guidance Fund.
subjects: Producers / Policy Makers; Chapter 4 assesses interview results; and Chapter 5 provides a conclusion.
Producers / Policy Makers; Chapter 4 assesses interview results; and Chapter 5 provides a conclusion.

It includes twenty seven sites in Kaohsiung City, thirteen sites in Kaohsiung County, and nine sites in Pingtung County. The author states in the preface that he hoped to create a “Filming Site Guide Book” for Southern Taiwan.Includes photos, maps, contact information, and a CD-ROM.

entries.note: The films of China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Japan, South and North Korea reflect political turmoil, conflict between modern life styles and traditional values, and the exchance of cultural heritages and mutual influences.Includes a DVD: Cinema on road: a personal essay on cinema in Korea by Jang Sun-woo; British Film Institute (1995: 52 min),  Bibliography, and Index.

entries.title: China, Hong Kong, and Taiwan: The convergence and interaction of Chinese film.
entries.publication: Ann Arbor, Mich.: University Microfilms International,­ 1993.­
entries.note: Thesis (Ph. D.)--University of North Texas, 1993.A work on the convergence and interaction of Chinese films produced in 			China, Hong Kong, and Taiwan. This is a photocopy of typescript.Includes bibliographical references (leaves. 87-95).

entries.titlep: Chinese national cinema.
entries.publication: New York: Routledge, 2004.
entries.ISBN: 0415172896 (hbk. alk. Paper) 9780415172899 (hbk. alk. Paper) 041517290X (pbk. alk. Paper) 9780415172905 (pbk. alk. Paper)
entries.seriesTitle: National Cinemas
entries.note: A serious academic work that provides thorough research and original perspectives. As the first attempt to outline Chinese film history in English with an up-to-date and “chronological history” study approach, the author uses a “Chinese national cinema” paradigm to cover all films produced in mainland China (including those prior to 1949), Hong Kong and Taiwan, while at the same time instructing the reader to keep in mind all associated problematics and “messiness” -- theoretical as well as geopolitical -- surrounding “China” and “Chineseness”. Th text forms a “general and potentially comparative framework of Chinese national cinema” in the three territories of mainland China, Hong Kong and Taiwan. Unlike many other works on the same subject, it provides a unique historical perspective: “Cinema and national traditions, 1896-1929”, “Cinema and the nation-people, 1930-49”,  “Cinematic reinvention of the national in Taiwan, 1896-1978”,  “Cinematic revival of the regional in Hong Kong, 1945-78”, “Cinema and the nation-state in the PRC, 1949-78”, “Cinema and national/regional cultures, 1979-89”,  “Cinema and the transnational imaginary, 1990-2002”.  This is not a comprehensive history of Chinese cinema; the author states: “this book concentrates primarily on feature films”.Since the publisher does not print Chinese characters, the author reasonably used Pinyin unless names are more commonly recognized in Wade-Giles or Cantonese (for more information regarding this tactic, see the “Romanization and Name spelling” section at the beginning of this volume). Almost all Chinese film titles in the text and index are presented in their English translations, without romanization or Chinese characters.Includes Bibliography and Index.
subjects: Films in Taiwan, Hong Kong, and Mainland China
